page.title: 09MINERS'STRIKE CONTINUED
page.content:
The Miner's Welfare provided travel tickets for those who needed them.
Pocket money became scarce and was often non-existant.
Thirteen long months had passed.The NUM reached a decision.The men would go back to work.
I shall never forget the day when the miners,including my Dad,marched back to work.Brass bands were playing--- everybody seemed happy--the marchers walked with their heads held high. A carnival atmosphere prevailed.
This dispute will live for long in our memories. It is my fervent hope that the bitter lessons learned will be as long-lasting!
